html:
Retirements

Austrian completes his career in Vienna

October 22, 2024

Clive Brunskill/Getty Images

Dominic Thiem defeated Roger Federer in the final of the 2019 BNP Paribas Open. By ATP Staff

Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal took to social media Tuesday following Dominic Thiemâ€™s loss at the Erste Bank Open to congratulate the Austrian on his retirement.

â€œAn illustrious career comes to a close,â€ Federer wrote in an Instagram story. â€œCongratulations Domi.â€

It's not goodbye. It's see you later ğŸ’™#DankeDomi | @ErsteBankOpen pic.twitter.com/keOAKBtOgJ

â€” ATP Tour (@atptour) October 22, 2024

Thiem won five of his seven Lexus ATP Head2Head meetings against Federer. Their lone championship clash came at the 2019 BNP Paribas Open, where the Austrian claimed his lone ATP Masters 1000 title.

â€œNo matter the surface, you always found a way to beat me with your thunderous backhands,â€ Federer wrote. â€œBut more importantly, you did it with grace and sportsmanship.â€

Nadal, who won their series 10-6 (Thiem earned four clay-court victories) also posted an Instagram Story, sharing the same sentiment as many: â€œDanke Domiâ€.
